intro: Galium consanguineum subsp. majmechense, commonly known as the Eastern bedstraw, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to eastern North America. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant features opposite, slender leaves and produces small, white or pale pink flowers in clusters. Its stems are often hairy and can become reddish with age. It is part of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with similar characteristics.
